The Author

Coach Lee DeForest

A basketball coach for almost 20 years, Lee DeForest learned to love the game spending time in the gym with his father and learned to love writing after graduating from law school. Most noted for his variation of the Princeton Offense, he won a state title in 2011.

Growing up in a small town in Kentucky with big dreams, he's published books on the Princeton Basketball Offense that have helped him make friends all over the world.

"My belief is that you can learn from the adversity and success in the stories of other people. We can all learn from one another to live a more successful and inspirational life."
— Coach DeForest

Why the Multiple Option Offense Works at Every Level

February 10, 2025 6 min read

If you've ever watched Kansas play under Bill Self, you've seen something that looks effortless — but is anything but. The Jayhawks run a system built on reads, not memorization. That's the core idea behind the Multiple Option Offense, and it's one of the most powerful systems you can install at any level of basketball.
